dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, Tesla's totally won the EV race, I guess. Nobody else even comes close.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, Tesla's totally won the E V race, I guess. Nobody else even comes close.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, well, actually, GM just laid out this pretty massive plan.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, well, actually, G M just laid out this pretty massive plan.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: the Detroit-based companys aggressive strategic shift includes becoming the North American market share leader in the technology over the next few years.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, they're investing like, an additional $7.5 billion, total $27.5 billion in EVs by 2025.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: $27.5 billion? That's just, uh, numbers on a spreadsheet. They're aiming for what?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: twenty seven point five dollars billion? That's just, uh, numbers on a spreadsheet. They're aiming for what?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: North American market share leader. And Barra said they're committed, even if it means a "brutal price war."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: North American market share leader. And Barra said they're committed, even if it means a brutal price war.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Were committed to fighting for EV market share until we are number one in North America.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Brutal price war? With who, exactly? Didn't they literally abandon their first EV attempt, like, decades ago?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Brutal price war? With who, exactly? Didn't they literally abandon their first E V attempt, like, decades ago?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: GM was a pioneer in battery-powered cars, releasing the EV1 subcompact in California 24 years ago as an early test vehicle, its abandonment of the technology created an opportunity for Musk and Tesla in the early 2000s.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That was the EV1, yeah. But now they're planning 35 battery-powered models globally by 2025.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That was the EV1, yeah. But now they're planning thirty five battery-powered models globally by twenty twenty five.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The biggest U.S. automaker plans to release 30 battery-powered models globally by 2025, two-thirds of which will be available to North American customers from its Cadillac, GMC, Chevrolet and Buick brands.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Thirty-five? And they expect to make money on all those? Seriously?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Thirty-five? And they expect to make money on all those? Seriously?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: They claim their new Ultium batteries are 40% cheaper than current ones, and the next gen will be 60% cheaper.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They claim their new Ultium batteries are forty percent cheaper than current ones, and the next gen will be sixty percent cheaper.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: GM says it will be able to sell electric vehicles with range of up to 400 miles per charge at a profit, owing to costs for its Ultium batteries that are about 40% below those currently used in its Bolt EV. A next-generation Ultium that arrives in a few years will be 60% cheaper than Bolt batteries and may offer a range of up to 450 miles per charge, said Doug Parks, GMs executive vice president for product development, purchasing and supply chain.

dialogue_turns.text: Cheaper how? Less range? That just sounds like, uh, wishful thinking.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Profitable. Sure. Tesla, the pioneer, took forever to turn a profit consistently.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Profitable. Sure. Tesla, the pioneer, took forever to turn a profit consistently.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Teslas steady sales and production growth and its recent run of five profitable quarters, the longest such stretch in company history, along with Musks uncommonly loyal fanbase, have made it the worlds most valuable automaker with a market capitalization of $473 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, the article did point out Tesla's production capacity and earnings are still a fraction of GM's overall.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, the article did point out Tesla's production capacity and earnings are still a fraction of G M's overall.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Teslas production capacity and earnings are a fraction of GMs.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: A fraction, but they're worth what, half a trillion? GM isn't even close to that, are they?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A fraction, but they're worth what, half a trillion? G M isn't even close to that, are they?

Along with electric Hummer and Cadillac models, the company is readying three other GMC models using the Ultium system, including an electric pickup, and four Chevrolet brand EVs, including a pickup and small crossover. Earlier this month, GM said it would hire 3,000 new tech workers before the end of 2021s first quarter to help with the accelerated EV push. Separately, Barra declined to comment on GMs potential partnership with hydrogen truckmaker Nikola Inc. With regard to other partnerships, we dont have anything specific to announce, she told Barclays equity analyst Brian Johnson. GM says it will be able to sell electric vehicles with range of up to 400 miles per charge at a profit, owing to costs for its Ultium batteries that are about 40% below those currently used in its Bolt EV. A next-generation Ultium that arrives in a few years will be 60% cheaper than Bolt batteries and may offer a range of up to 450 miles per charge, said Doug Parks, GMs executive vice president for product development, purchasing and supply chain. Additional cost savings will come from commonizing more parts across all of GMs product lines. GMs EV development times are speeding up and costs are going down rapidly, so we expect our Ultium EV programs to be profitable from the first generation on, Parks said. GM shares were little changed, closing at $42.82 in New York trading. Forbes.com
